document_title: Dangerous neurological diseases: Causes and symptoms
subsection_content:
Neurologic Diseases or neurological disorders are diseases that affect the nervous system including the nerves, brain and roots, plexuses, and nerves. The nervous system is the part that controls all body functions. Therefore, any damage or abnormality in the nervous system also leads to symptoms in different parts of the body.
There are hundreds of diseases in the nervous system, affecting millions of people around the world (1). Specifically, statistics from the World Health Organization (WHO) show:
Each year, about 6.2 million people die from stroke-related causes (this number in Vietnam is more than 11,000 people). (2); More than 50 million people around the world suffer from epilepsy.; About 35.5 million people have dementia (Alzheimer's disease is the most common cause (accounting for 60 - 70% of cases).; About 6.3 million patients have Parkinson's disease worldwide.; About 10 % of patients with migraine.
